items.longDescription:
Introduction of Detective Conan (Case Closed)

After solving a case, high school detective Shinichi Kudo witnessed men dressed all in black engaging in suspicious activity. In an attempt to silence him, they force-fed him a mysterious drug that caused his body to shrink to that of a first grader. Gosho Aoyama's mystery manga "Detective Conan (Case Closed)", which began serialization in "Weekly Shonen Sunday" in 1994, is now a very popular manga with more than 100 volumes. This original design, featuring fan-favorite scenes from the original manga and art from the TV anime, is available only at UNIQLO.

©Gosho Aoyama/Shogakukan
items.name: Detective Conan UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: Here comes the UT of the most popular manga "Detective Conan (Case Closed)". A selection of precious designs from the original manga and the TV anime materials.

items.longDescription:
A symbolic design featured on the front incorporates an exquisite collage artwork by the renowned artist Kosuke Kawamura that depicts Chainsaw Man in the ending of episode 3. The graphic is accompanied by a quote from Makima, a member of the devil-hunting organization Public Safety Devil Hunters Tokyo Special Division 4, “All devils were born with names. The scarier the name is, the more powerful it is.”. On the front is an unedited frame of the same scene printed on the back.

Chainsaw Man × Kosuke Kawamura

Chainsaw Man is a TV anime series produced by MAPPA. The story follows a young devil hunter named Denji who makes a contract with Chainsaw Devil and is reincarnated as “Chainsaw Man.” The anime has received a lot of attention and positive feedback since its release. This time, we have collaborated with collage artist Kosuke Kawamura to recreate the world of the series in a bold and meticulous way. Enjoy this special collection that brings the world of Chainsaw Man to life.

Kosuke Kawamura
Kawamura was born in Hiroshima in 1979. His work as a collage artist has led to a variety of creative projects, from solo exhibitions around the world to corporate collaborations. He became the Creative Director of UT in 2022.

©Tatsuki Fujimoto/SHUEISHA, MAPPA
©Kosuke Kawamura

Pieck and Porco join hands to make a surprise attack on Eren. Eren chooses to become a Titan in order to fight back after being taken off guard by Porco. The scene is printed prominently on the front of the T-shirt. Eren is surrounded by steam as he transforms into a Titan, and his thunderous roar is highlighted in red, adding to the design’s color palette.

Attack on titan

The popular manga series written and illustrated by Hajime Isayama was serialized in “Bessatsu Shonen Magazine” from 2009 to 2021, the cumulative circulation has exceeded 110 million copies worldwide, and it continues to create shock waves not only in Japan but also around the world. These UT are inspired by this manga which captures the reader’s attention with a world where humanity is forced to live in cities surrounded by enormous “walls” that protect them from gigantic man-eating humanoids referred to as Titans, and “Vertical maneuvering equipment” developed to combat the Titans.

©Hajime Isayama / Kodansha Ltd.
